definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)

sentences.english: He cocked his hat and twirled his stick.
sentences.chinese: 他歪戴着帽子，挥舞着手杖。

sentences.english: He sports an ivory-handled cane these days.
sentences.chinese: 这些天，他夸耀着他的镶有象牙的手杖。

sentences.english: He has made a walking stick for his grandfather from the bamboo pole.
sentences.chinese: 他用这根竹杆给他祖父做了根手杖。

sentences.english: Mary jabbed her stick into the ground.
sentences.chinese: 玛莉把手杖戳进了地里。

sentences.english: He bluffed me into thinking that his stick was a gun.
sentences.chinese: 他唬得我相信他的手杖是一支枪。

sentences.english: DEFEND】When the dog attacked me, I defended myself with my stick.
sentences.chinese: 那只狗攻击我时，我用手杖保护自己。

sentences.english: He switched the boy with a cane.
sentences.chinese: 他用手杖抽打那个小孩。

sentences.english: An old woman came along the road leaning on her staff.
sentences.chinese: 有一个老太婆拄着手杖沿路走过来。

sentences.english: In the fog he felt for the kerb with his walking stick.
sentences.chinese: 在雾中他用手杖摸索街道的镶边石。

sentences.english: The old man cannot walk without a stick.
sentences.chinese: 那位老先生离开手杖就走不了路。

sentences.english: The old man brandished his walking stick at the menacing dog.
sentences.chinese: 老人对著那条要咬他的狗挥舞手杖吓牠走。
他还拿着根金头的手杖。

sentences.english: His cane answered for a baseball bat.
sentences.chinese: 他的手杖可代用棒球棒。

sentences.english: He carried a mahogany cane with a silver head to it .
sentences.chinese: 他提着一根柄上镶银的红木手杖。

sentences.english: The blind man tapped his cane on the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 盲人用手杖敲击人行道。

sentences.english: He propped his stick against the wall.

definition: a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)
